comment: * Contains methods to standard constants used in the UI for timeouts, sizes, and distances.

variables.name: SCROLL_BAR_SIZE
variables.comment:
* Defines the width of the horizontal scrollbar and the height of the vertical scrollbar in
     * dips

variables.name: SCROLL_BAR_FADE_DURATION
variables.comment: * Duration of the fade when scrollbars fade away in milliseconds

variables.name: SCROLL_BAR_DEFAULT_DELAY
variables.comment: * Default delay before the scrollbars fade in milliseconds

variables.name: FADING_EDGE_LENGTH
variables.comment: * Defines the length of the fading edges in dips

variables.name: PRESSED_STATE_DURATION
variables.comment:
* Defines the duration in milliseconds of the pressed state in child
     * components.

variables.name: DEFAULT_LONG_PRESS_TIMEOUT
variables.comment:
* Defines the default duration in milliseconds before a press turns into
     * a long press
     * @hide

variables.name: DEFAULT_MULTI_PRESS_TIMEOUT
variables.comment:
* Defines the default duration in milliseconds between the first tap's up event and the second
     * tap's down event for an interaction to be considered part of the same multi-press.

variables.name: KEY_REPEAT_DELAY
variables.comment: * Defines the time between successive key repeats in milliseconds.

variables.name: GLOBAL_ACTIONS_KEY_TIMEOUT
variables.comment:
* Defines the duration in milliseconds a user needs to hold down the
     * appropriate button to bring up the global actions dialog (power off,
     * lock screen, etc).

variables.name: SCREENSHOT_CHORD_KEY_TIMEOUT
variables.comment:
* Defines the duration in milliseconds a user needs to hold down the
     * appropriate buttons (power + volume down) to trigger the screenshot chord.

variables.name: A11Y_SHORTCUT_KEY_TIMEOUT
variables.comment:
* Defines the duration in milliseconds a user needs to hold down the
     * appropriate button to bring up the accessibility shortcut for the first time

variables.name: A11Y_SHORTCUT_KEY_TIMEOUT_AFTER_CONFIRMATION
variables.comment:
* Defines the duration in milliseconds a user needs to hold down the
     * appropriate button to enable the accessibility shortcut once it's configured.

variables.name: TAP_TIMEOUT
variables.comment:
* Defines the duration in milliseconds we will wait to see if a touch event
     * is a tap or a scroll. If the user does not move within this interval, it is
     * considered to be a tap.

variables.name: JUMP_TAP_TIMEOUT
variables.comment:
* Defines the duration in milliseconds we will wait to see if a touch event
     * is a jump tap. If the user does not complete the jump tap within this interval, it is
     * considered to be a tap.

variables.name: DOUBLE_TAP_TIMEOUT
variables.comment:
* Defines the duration in milliseconds between the first tap's up event and
     * the second tap's down event for an interaction to be considered a
     * double-tap.

variables.name: DOUBLE_TAP_MIN_TIME
variables.comment:
* Defines the minimum duration in milliseconds between the first tap's up event and
     * the second tap's down event for an interaction to be considered a
     * double-tap.

variables.name: HOVER_TAP_TIMEOUT
variables.comment:
* Defines the maximum duration in milliseconds between a touch pad
     * touch and release for a given touch to be considered a tap (click) as
     * opposed to a hover movement gesture.

variables.name: HOVER_TAP_SLOP
variables.comment:
* Defines the maximum distance in pixels that a touch pad touch can move
     * before being released for it to be considered a tap (click) as opposed
     * to a hover movement gesture.

variables.name: ZOOM_CONTROLS_TIMEOUT
variables.comment:
* Defines the duration in milliseconds we want to display zoom controls in response
     * to a user panning within an application.

variables.name: EDGE_SLOP
variables.comment: * Inset in dips to look for touchable content when the user touches the edge of the screen

variables.name: TOUCH_SLOP
variables.comment:
* Distance a touch can wander before we think the user is scrolling in dips.
     * Note that this value defined here is only used as a fallback by legacy/misbehaving
     * applications that do not provide a Context for determining density/configuration-dependent
     * values.
     *
     * To alter this value, see the configuration resource config_viewConfigurationTouchSlop
     * in frameworks/base/core/res/res/values/config.xml or the appropriate device resource overlay.
     * It may be appropriate to tweak this on a device-specific basis in an overlay based on
     * the characteristics of the touch panel and firmware.

variables.name: MIN_SCROLLBAR_TOUCH_TARGET
variables.comment: * Defines the minimum size of the touch target for a scrollbar in dips

variables.name: DOUBLE_TAP_TOUCH_SLOP
variables.comment:
* Distance the first touch can wander before we stop considering this event a double tap
     * (in dips)

variables.name: PAGING_TOUCH_SLOP
variables.comment:
* Distance a touch can wander before we think the user is attempting a paged scroll
     * (in dips)
     *
     * Note that this value defined here is only used as a fallback by legacy/misbehaving
     * applications that do not provide a Context for determining density/configuration-dependent
     * values.
     *
     * See the note above on {@link #TOUCH_SLOP} regarding the dimen resource
     * config_viewConfigurationTouchSlop. ViewConfiguration will report a paging touch slop of
     * config_viewConfigurationTouchSlop * 2 when provided with a Context.

variables.name: DOUBLE_TAP_SLOP
variables.comment: * Distance in dips between the first touch and second touch to still be considered a double tap

variables.name: WINDOW_TOUCH_SLOP
variables.comment:
* Distance in dips a touch needs to be outside of a window's bounds for it to
     * count as outside for purposes of dismissing the window.

variables.name: MINIMUM_FLING_VELOCITY
variables.comment: * Minimum velocity to initiate a fling, as measured in dips per second

variables.name: MAXIMUM_FLING_VELOCITY
variables.comment: * Maximum velocity to initiate a fling, as measured in dips per second

variables.name: SEND_RECURRING_ACCESSIBILITY_EVENTS_INTERVAL_MILLIS
variables.comment:
* Delay before dispatching a recurring accessibility event in milliseconds.
     * This delay guarantees that a recurring event will be send at most once
     * during the {@link #SEND_RECURRING_ACCESSIBILITY_EVENTS_INTERVAL_MILLIS} time
     * frame.

variables.name: MAXIMUM_DRAWING_CACHE_SIZE
variables.comment:
* The maximum size of View's drawing cache, expressed in bytes. This size
     * should be at least equal to the size of the screen in ARGB888 format.

variables.name: SCROLL_FRICTION
variables.comment: * The coefficient of friction applied to flings/scrolls.

variables.name: OVERSCROLL_DISTANCE
variables.comment: * Max distance in dips to overscroll for edge effects

variables.name: OVERFLING_DISTANCE
variables.comment: * Max distance in dips to overfling for edge effects

variables.name: HORIZONTAL_SCROLL_FACTOR
variables.comment:
* Amount to scroll in response to a horizontal {@link MotionEvent#ACTION_SCROLL} event,
     * in dips per axis value.

variables.name: VERTICAL_SCROLL_FACTOR
variables.comment:
* Amount to scroll in response to a vertical {@link MotionEvent#ACTION_SCROLL} event,
     * in dips per axis value.

variables.name: ACTION_MODE_HIDE_DURATION_DEFAULT
variables.comment: * Default duration to hide an action mode for.

variables.name: LONG_PRESS_TOOLTIP_HIDE_TIMEOUT
variables.comment:
* Defines the duration in milliseconds before an end of a long press causes a tooltip to be
     * hidden.

variables.name: HOVER_TOOLTIP_SHOW_TIMEOUT
variables.comment: * Defines the duration in milliseconds before a hover event causes a tooltip to be shown.

variables.name: HOVER_TOOLTIP_HIDE_TIMEOUT
variables.comment:
* Defines the duration in milliseconds before mouse inactivity causes a tooltip to be hidden.
     * (default variant to be used when {@link View#SYSTEM_UI_FLAG_LOW_PROFILE} is not set).

variables.name: HOVER_TOOLTIP_HIDE_SHORT_TIMEOUT
variables.comment:
* Defines the duration in milliseconds before mouse inactivity causes a tooltip to be hidden
     * (short version to be used when {@link View#SYSTEM_UI_FLAG_LOW_PROFILE} is set).

variables.name: HAS_PERMANENT_MENU_KEY_AUTODETECT
variables.comment:
* Configuration values for overriding {@link #hasPermanentMenuKey()} behavior.
     * These constants must match the definition in res/values/config.xml.

variables.name: AMBIGUOUS_GESTURE_MULTIPLIER
variables.comment: * The multiplication factor for inhibiting default gestures.

methods.name: public static ViewConfiguration get(Context context)
methods.comment:
* Returns a configuration for the specified visual {@link Context}. The configuration depends
     * on various parameters of the {@link Context}, like the dimension of the display or the
     * density of the display.
     *
     * @param context A visual {@link Context} used to initialize the view configuration. It must
     *                be {@link Activity} or other {@link Context} created with
     *                {@link Context#createWindowContext(int, Bundle)}.

methods.name: public static int getScrollBarSize()
methods.comment:
* @return The width of the horizontal scrollbar and the height of the vertical
     *         scrollbar in dips
     *
     * @deprecated Use {@link #getScaledScrollBarSize()} instead.

methods.name: public int getScaledScrollBarSize()
methods.comment:
* @return The width of the horizontal scrollbar and the height of the vertical
     *         scrollbar in pixels

methods.name: public int getScaledMinScrollbarTouchTarget()
methods.comment:
* @return the minimum size of the scrollbar thumb's touch target in pixels
     * @hide

methods.name: public static int getScrollBarFadeDuration()
methods.comment: * @return Duration of the fade when scrollbars fade away in milliseconds

methods.name: public static int getScrollDefaultDelay()
methods.comment: * @return Default delay before the scrollbars fade in milliseconds

methods.name: public static int getFadingEdgeLength()
methods.comment:
* @return the length of the fading edges in dips
     *
     * @deprecated Use {@link #getScaledFadingEdgeLength()} instead.

methods.name: public int getScaledFadingEdgeLength()
methods.comment: * @return the length of the fading edges in pixels

methods.name: public static int getPressedStateDuration()
methods.comment:
* @return the duration in milliseconds of the pressed state in child
     * components.

methods.name: public static int getLongPressTimeout()
methods.comment:
* @return the duration in milliseconds before a press turns into
     * a long press

methods.name: public static int getMultiPressTimeout()
methods.comment:
* @return the duration in milliseconds between the first tap's up event and the second tap's
     * down event for an interaction to be considered part of the same multi-press.
     * @hide

methods.name: public static int getKeyRepeatTimeout()
methods.comment: * @return the time before the first key repeat in milliseconds.

methods.name: public static int getKeyRepeatDelay()
methods.comment: * @return the time between successive key repeats in milliseconds.

methods.name: public static int getTapTimeout()
methods.comment:
* @return the duration in milliseconds we will wait to see if a touch event
     * is a tap or a scroll. If the user does not move within this interval, it is
     * considered to be a tap.

methods.name: public static int getJumpTapTimeout()
methods.comment:
* @return the duration in milliseconds we will wait to see if a touch event
     * is a jump tap. If the user does not move within this interval, it is
     * considered to be a tap.

methods.name: public static int getDoubleTapTimeout()
methods.comment:
* @return the duration in milliseconds between the first tap's up event and
     * the second tap's down event for an interaction to be considered a
     * double-tap.

methods.name: public static int getDoubleTapMinTime()
methods.comment:
* @return the minimum duration in milliseconds between the first tap's
     * up event and the second tap's down event for an interaction to be considered a
     * double-tap.
     *
     * @hide

methods.name: public static int getHoverTapTimeout()
methods.comment:
* @return the maximum duration in milliseconds between a touch pad
     * touch and release for a given touch to be considered a tap (click) as
     * opposed to a hover movement gesture.
     * @hide

methods.name: public static int getHoverTapSlop()
methods.comment:
* @return the maximum distance in pixels that a touch pad touch can move
     * before being released for it to be considered a tap (click) as opposed
     * to a hover movement gesture.
     * @hide

methods.name: public static int getEdgeSlop()
methods.comment:
* @return Inset in dips to look for touchable content when the user touches the edge of the
     *         screen
     *
     * @deprecated Use {@link #getScaledEdgeSlop()} instead.

methods.name: public int getScaledEdgeSlop()
methods.comment:
* @return Inset in pixels to look for touchable content when the user touches the edge of the
     *         screen

methods.name: public static int getTouchSlop()
methods.comment:
* @return Distance in dips a touch can wander before we think the user is scrolling
     *
     * @deprecated Use {@link #getScaledTouchSlop()} instead.

methods.name: public int getScaledTouchSlop()
methods.comment: * @return Distance in pixels a touch can wander before we think the user is scrolling

methods.name: public int getScaledHoverSlop()
methods.comment:
* @return Distance in pixels a hover can wander while it is still considered "stationary".
     *

methods.name: public int getScaledDoubleTapTouchSlop()
methods.comment:
* @return Distance in pixels the first touch can wander before we do not consider this a
     * potential double tap event
     * @hide

methods.name: public int getScaledPagingTouchSlop()
methods.comment:
* @return Distance in pixels a touch can wander before we think the user is scrolling a full
     * page

methods.name: public static int getDoubleTapSlop()
methods.comment:
* @return Distance in dips between the first touch and second touch to still be
     *         considered a double tap
     * @deprecated Use {@link #getScaledDoubleTapSlop()} instead.
     * @hide The only client of this should be GestureDetector, which needs this
     *       for clients that still use its deprecated constructor.

methods.name: public int getScaledDoubleTapSlop()
methods.comment:
* @return Distance in pixels between the first touch and second touch to still be
     *         considered a double tap

methods.name: public static long getSendRecurringAccessibilityEventsInterval()
methods.comment:
* Interval for dispatching a recurring accessibility event in milliseconds.
     * This interval guarantees that a recurring event will be send at most once
     * during the {@link #getSendRecurringAccessibilityEventsInterval()} time frame.
     *
     * @return The delay in milliseconds.
     *
     * @hide

methods.name: public static int getWindowTouchSlop()
methods.comment:
* @return Distance in dips a touch must be outside the bounds of a window for it
     * to be counted as outside the window for purposes of dismissing that
     * window.
     *
     * @deprecated Use {@link #getScaledWindowTouchSlop()} instead.

methods.name: public int getScaledWindowTouchSlop()
methods.comment:
* @return Distance in pixels a touch must be outside the bounds of a window for it
     * to be counted as outside the window for purposes of dismissing that window.

methods.name: public static int getMinimumFlingVelocity()
methods.comment:
* @return Minimum velocity to initiate a fling, as measured in dips per second.
     *
     * @deprecated Use {@link #getScaledMinimumFlingVelocity()} instead.

methods.name: public int getScaledMinimumFlingVelocity()
methods.comment: * @return Minimum velocity to initiate a fling, as measured in pixels per second.

methods.name: public static int getMaximumFlingVelocity()
methods.comment:
* @return Maximum velocity to initiate a fling, as measured in dips per second.
     *
     * @deprecated Use {@link #getScaledMaximumFlingVelocity()} instead.

methods.name: public int getScaledMaximumFlingVelocity()
methods.comment: * @return Maximum velocity to initiate a fling, as measured in pixels per second.

methods.name: public int getScaledScrollFactor()
methods.comment:
* @return Amount to scroll in response to a {@link MotionEvent#ACTION_SCROLL} event. Multiply
     * this by the event's axis value to obtain the number of pixels to be scrolled.
     *
     * @removed

methods.name: public float getScaledHorizontalScrollFactor()
methods.comment:
* @return Amount to scroll in response to a horizontal {@link MotionEvent#ACTION_SCROLL} event.
     * Multiply this by the event's axis value to obtain the number of pixels to be scrolled.

methods.name: public float getScaledVerticalScrollFactor()
methods.comment:
* @return Amount to scroll in response to a vertical {@link MotionEvent#ACTION_SCROLL} event.
     * Multiply this by the event's axis value to obtain the number of pixels to be scrolled.

methods.name: public static int getMaximumDrawingCacheSize()
methods.comment:
* The maximum drawing cache size expressed in bytes.
     *
     * @return the maximum size of View's drawing cache expressed in bytes
     *
     * @deprecated Use {@link #getScaledMaximumDrawingCacheSize()} instead.

methods.name: public int getScaledMaximumDrawingCacheSize()
methods.comment:
* The maximum drawing cache size expressed in bytes.
     *
     * @return the maximum size of View's drawing cache expressed in bytes

methods.name: public int getScaledOverscrollDistance()
methods.comment:
* @return The maximum distance a View should overscroll by when showing edge effects (in
     * pixels).

methods.name: public int getScaledOverflingDistance()
methods.comment:
* @return The maximum distance a View should overfling by when showing edge effects (in
     * pixels).

methods.name: public static long getZoomControlsTimeout()
methods.comment:
* The amount of time that the zoom controls should be
     * displayed on the screen expressed in milliseconds.
     *
     * @return the time the zoom controls should be visible expressed
     * in milliseconds.

methods.name: public static long getGlobalActionKeyTimeout()
methods.comment:
* The amount of time a user needs to press the relevant key to bring up
     * the global actions dialog.
     *
     * @return how long a user needs to press the relevant key to bring up
     *   the global actions dialog.
     * @deprecated This timeout should not be used by applications

methods.name: public long getDeviceGlobalActionKeyTimeout()
methods.comment:
* The amount of time a user needs to press the relevant key to bring up
     * the global actions dialog.
     *
     * @return how long a user needs to press the relevant key to bring up
     *   the global actions dialog.
     * @hide

methods.name: public long getScreenshotChordKeyTimeout()
methods.comment:
* The amount of time a user needs to press the relevant keys to trigger
     * the screenshot chord.
     *
     * @return how long a user needs to press the relevant keys to trigger
     *   the screenshot chord.
     * @hide

methods.name: public long getAccessibilityShortcutKeyTimeout()
methods.comment:
* The amount of time a user needs to press the relevant keys to activate the accessibility
     * shortcut.
     *
     * @return how long a user needs to press the relevant keys to activate the accessibility
     *   shortcut.
     * @hide

methods.name: public long getAccessibilityShortcutKeyTimeoutAfterConfirmation()
methods.comment:
* @return The amount of time a user needs to press the relevant keys to activate the
     *   accessibility shortcut after it's confirmed that accessibility shortcut is used.
     * @hide

methods.name: public static float getScrollFriction()
methods.comment:
* The amount of friction applied to scrolls and flings.
     *
     * @return A scalar dimensionless value representing the coefficient of
     *         friction.

methods.name: public static long getDefaultActionModeHideDuration()
methods.comment: * @return the default duration in milliseconds for {@link ActionMode#hide(long)}.

methods.name: public static float getAmbiguousGestureMultiplier()
methods.comment:
* The multiplication factor for inhibiting default gestures.
     *
     * If a MotionEvent has {@link android.view.MotionEvent#CLASSIFICATION_AMBIGUOUS_GESTURE} set,
     * then certain actions, such as scrolling, will be inhibited. However, to account for the
     * possibility of an incorrect classification, existing gesture thresholds (e.g. scrolling
     * touch slop and the long-press timeout) should be scaled by this factor and remain in effect.
     *
     * @deprecated Use {@link #getScaledAmbiguousGestureMultiplier()}.

methods.name: public float getScaledAmbiguousGestureMultiplier()
methods.comment:
* The multiplication factor for inhibiting default gestures.
     *
     * If a MotionEvent has {@link android.view.MotionEvent#CLASSIFICATION_AMBIGUOUS_GESTURE} set,
     * then certain actions, such as scrolling, will be inhibited. However, to account for the
     * possibility of an incorrect classification, existing gesture thresholds (e.g. scrolling
     * touch slop and the long-press timeout) should be scaled by this factor and remain in effect.

methods.name: public boolean hasPermanentMenuKey()
methods.comment:
* Report if the device has a permanent menu key available to the user. * *

As of Android 3.0, devices may not have a permanent menu key available. * Apps should use the action bar to present menu options to users. * However, there are some apps where the action bar is inappropriate * or undesirable. This method may be used to detect if a menu key is present. * If not, applications should provide another on-screen affordance to access * functionality. * * @return true if a permanent menu key is present, false otherwise.

methods.name: public boolean shouldShowMenuShortcutsWhenKeyboardPresent()
methods.comment:
* Check if shortcuts should be displayed in menus.
     *
     * @return {@code True} if shortcuts should be displayed in menus.

methods.name: public int getScaledMinimumScalingSpan()
methods.comment:
* Retrieves the distance in pixels between touches that must be reached for a gesture to be
     * interpreted as scaling.
     *
     * In general, scaling shouldn't start until this distance has been met or surpassed, and
     * scaling should end when the distance in pixels between touches drops below this distance.
     *
     * @return The distance in pixels
     * @throws IllegalStateException if this method is called on a ViewConfiguration that was
     *         instantiated using a constructor with no Context parameter.

methods.name: public boolean isFadingMarqueeEnabled()
methods.comment:
* @hide
     * @return Whether or not marquee should use fading edges.

methods.name: public static int getLongPressTooltipHideTimeout()
methods.comment:
* @return the duration in milliseconds before an end of a long press causes a tooltip to be
     * hidden
     * @hide

methods.name: public static int getHoverTooltipShowTimeout()
methods.comment:
* @return the duration in milliseconds before a hover event causes a tooltip to be shown
     * @hide

methods.name: public static int getHoverTooltipHideTimeout()
methods.comment:
* @return the duration in milliseconds before mouse inactivity causes a tooltip to be hidden
     * (default variant to be used when {@link View#SYSTEM_UI_FLAG_LOW_PROFILE} is not set).
     * @hide

methods.name: public static int getHoverTooltipHideShortTimeout()
methods.comment:
* @return the duration in milliseconds before mouse inactivity causes a tooltip to be hidden
     * (shorter variant to be used when {@link View#SYSTEM_UI_FLAG_LOW_PROFILE} is set).
     * @hide
